definition: extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me

sentences.english: We have to cut our coat according to our cloth. Nowadays there's no margin at all.
sentences.chinese: 如今都是可着头做帽子，一点富余也不能的。

sentences.english: We have two tickets to spare.
Science could yet provide the tools to restore some of our superabundance .
sentences.chinese: 科学可以提供工具来恢复一些我们的富余。

sentences.english: Or buy a loaded car like the Hyundai Sonata at half the price.
sentences.chinese: 或者半价买那种现代索纳塔那样的富余车。

sentences.english: If I had the money to spare, I'd be happy to lend it to you.
sentences.chinese: 如果我手里的钱有富余的话，我很乐意借点给你。

sentences.english: Loss of superabundant prey is another issue, Smith says.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯说，猎物不再富余对狼来说也是问题。

sentences.english: I have got several spare tickets.
How many spare glass jars didI need to keep on hand?
sentences.chinese: 我手头需要留多少富余的玻璃罐子？

sentences.english: To develop modern physical distribution in railway train department is an effective means to solve the surplus staff.
sentences.chinese: 铁路车务段发展现代物流是解决富余人员的有效手段。

definition: to leave sth unused/to lie idle
to furnish/to provide/supply (as in supply and demand)
lit. pulling on the lapels exposes the elbows (idiom)/strapped for cash/unable to make ends meet
